moves.1. d4 c5 2. dxc5 Nc6 3. e4 e6 4. Nc3 Nf6: ~ my defeat is almost certain. No way my poor pawns will be able to promote. But I have sometihng else up my sleeve :)
moves.50... Kg5: Vain attempt to guard both pawns.
moves.51. Qg8+: Checked in hopes of a skewer.
moves.51... Kf4: But moving close to his King will not help me.
moves.52. Qf7+: Pushing me further towards the enemy.
moves.52... Ke3: Probably not the best place for my King.
moves.53... Kd4: Reunited with another isolated pawn, but the other is no more.
moves.54... e4: Okay - can I get a Queen?
moves.55. Qg4: A pin - he wants another skewer in order to clear the board of black pawn islands.
moves.56. Qf5: Another pin, another attack on my pawn.
moves.56... Kd4: I'll leave a path to advance my pawn.
moves.59. b5: Bet I'll get a Queen before you get another!
moves.60. Qe1: Oops, there goes my promotion square!
moves.61. Qxe2+: Sacrifice! Nevermind, you'll get her back.
moves.63. b7: nothing I can do to stop it.
moves.63... Kc2: Can I kill the doubled pawn? NO!
moves.66. b5: I will not be able to stop it. But something else is in mind!
moves.67. b6: I see the possible folly of a Second Queen.
moves.67... Kb4: By now someone might be overconfident.
moves.68. b7: Just get out of his way, already!
moves.68... Kb5: I see the bushes - I'll hide!
moves.69. Qc7: Don't some any closer! This is perhaps the biggest mistake in the world - and he does not see it until it's all over!
moves.69... Ka6: The bushes at last! Now just promote to Rook and it will be over!
moves.70. b8=Q: NO! You fool! I can't go anywhere! a 70-move STALEMATE!
